title: Development Diary Summary
body_html:
Development Diary

Over the recent period, we've been deeply engaged in multiple innovative projects that span tool integration, multi-agent AI system enhancements, and collaborative knowledge management. Key highlights include:

1. Plane Project Management Integration

  • Successfully interfaced with Plane to list projects and retrieve issue details.
  • Created and managed issues dynamically within projects such as ReactiveResume MCP Project, enhancing tracking of Letta agent lockup problems.

2. Multi-Agent System Communication

  • Developed robust mechanisms for capturing, logging, and synchronizing chat events across Letta agents into a unified Graphiti knowledge graph.
  • Emphasized reliable webhook design and proxy-based message interception for real-time context augmentation.

3. Archival Memory and Document Handling

  • Investigated and integrated advanced document handling strategies inspired by OpenWebUI, focusing on semantic similarity and chunking to improve document retrieval coherence.

4. Tool Discovery and Dynamic Attachment

  • Leveraged Letta's tool-finding capabilities to dynamically discover, attach, and utilize relevant MCP tools, enhancing agent adaptability and workflow automation.

5. Challenges and Learnings

  • Encountered limitations with OpenWebUI client development, leading to considerations for building a custom client solution.
  • Navigated complexities of base64 data handling, memory synchronization, and multi-tool orchestration.

This diary will evolve as we continue to develop, troubleshoot, and expand our system capabilities, serving as both a reflective record and a guide for future efforts.
